info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 11:02PM EDT until July 31 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Radford, Montgomery and Pulaski.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Continued flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1057 PM EDT, Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain fell earlier this evening. While water levels in area creeks and streams continue to recede, some roads may still be impacted by high water and washed out debris. Motorists are urged to drive with caution. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Toms Creek, Connellys Run, Stroubles Creek, Slate Branch, Crab Creek, New River and Back Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Radford... Fairlawn... Walton... Prices Fork... - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.
